ygData.subject: Re: Boat Crashes
ygData.msgSnippet: I do not believe bards playing songs has anything to do with boats crashing. Every time I get on the boat I equip my mandolin and play Hymn to keep my strings
ygData.messageBody:
I do not believe bards playing songs has anything to do with boats crashing.
Every time I get on the boat I equip my mandolin and play Hymn to keep my
strings skill maxed out. I haven't had any problems with it as of yet.

Tanthalias
Half Elven Bard
Tarew Marr


Original Message:
> Date: Mon, 14 Jun 1999 01:01:25 -0500
> From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <slide@...>
>Subject: Boat Crashes
>
> I had one heck of a night trying to get back to Freeport from
Butcherblock - the boat crashed three times. What would happen is first
all the other players on the boat would disappear then you'd get dumped...
The first time I was back on the dock in BB then next time on the boat on
the way to BB and then finally on the boat on the way to Freeport.
>
> The reason I bring it up here - is that several whiny players claimed
that the cause of the crash is bards playing songs on the boat... The first
time I was in fact playing a song and thought that it might contribute. The
second time - no bards were playing (assuming no one in the hold was) and it
crashed anyways. I think this was true the third dump as well.
>
> So I am wondering if people have any experience in this. My gut is
that there is no relation between the two - and this is yet another myth
(like all bard songs will require mana!)
>
>Slyde of Xegony
